description:
Five years after a mystifying disaster decimates cities across the globe, Seria Morino receives an invitation from a mysterious woman to join Alice in Theater, a small stage troupe that takes it upon themselves to brighten the world through their performances using 3D hologram technology. As Seria settles in, she begins to uncover unexpected truths about herself and the world around her…

(Source: Funimation)

Note: The BD box with all episodes was released on Mar 3, 2021. The regular broadcast ended on Mar 23, 2021 on AT-X.
synonyms: เหล่าไอดอลในโลกหลังภัยพิบัติ

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Augmented Reality
tags.description: Prominently features events with augmented reality as the main setting.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

title.native: アリスインデッドリースクール

node.description:
**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.
He is a member of Writers Guild of Japan.

Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/), where he initially worked as a composite artist.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [other director](https://anilist.co/staff/101468/) by the same name._

Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/), where he initially worked as a composite artist.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [other director](https://anilist.co/staff/101468/) by the same name._
He is a member of Writers Guild of Japan.

Scriptwriter and production manager affiliated with [Lapin Track](https://anilist.co/studio/6213/Lapin-Track). Originating as a production manager for [Brain's Base](https://anilist.co/studio/112/Brains-Base) before slowly transitioning into a scriptwriter under them.

Founder of animation studio Lapin Track alongside [Masakazu Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/148153/Masakazu-Watanabe).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小島正幸) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masayuki_Kojima)

Originating from Kaname Production, currently affiliated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/).

Known for directing shows such as [Monster](https://anilist.co/anime/19/), [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/) and [Hanada Shounen-shi](https://anilist.co/anime/2004/).

Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/), where he initially worked as a composite artist.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [other director](https://anilist.co/staff/101468/) by the same name._

**Height:** 158 cm
**Agency:** Yellow Cab Next

[Profile](http://www.yellow-cab-next.jp/mao-ichimichi.html)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Snow White - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Luka Millfy - Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger (TV Series)
- Raptor 283 - Uchuu Sentai Kyuuranger (TV Series)
- Varesa - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Celestia - Strinova (VG)

[Profile (VIMS)](http://vims.co.jp/talent_profile_detail.php?id=23) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nojomiy)

**Non-anime roles:**
~!
- Ao in "Akatsuki no Yona" (Drama CD) (Japanese)
- Cosmo Hōjō in "Pretty Rhythm Rainbow Live: Kira Kira My☆Deco Design" (VG) (Japanese)
- Jane in "Granado Espada" (MMORPG) (Japanese)
- Kuu-chan in "Sei Madou Monogatari" (VG) (Japanese)
- Nagisa Shiota in "Ansatsu Kyōshitsu" (VOMIC) (Japanese)
- Nosuri in "Utawarerumono: Itsuwari no Kamen/Futari no Hakuoro" (VG)
- Ricotta in "Ys VIII: Lacrimosa of Dana" (VG) (Japanese)
- Rika Jougasaki in "Granblue Fantasy" (VG) (Japanese)
- Rika Jougasaki in "THE IDOLM@STER CINDERELLA MASTER 005: Rika Jougasaki" (Music/Drama CD) (Japanese)
- Yukimura Kusunoki in "Boku wa Tomodachi ga Sukunai" (drama CD) (Japanese)!~

[Profile](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/satoamina/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sato_amina8/)

An ex-member of AKB48 (2007-2014). She announced her marriage on February 1, 2019.
